title: Existing lockfile not preserved on write error
body:
While debugging #18338 I noticed that if an error occurs during the write operation of an environment, any `spack.lock` existing before the command might be removed by Spack.


### Steps to reproduce the issue
Use the following:
```yaml
spack:
  specs:
  - openjpeg
  packages:
    cmake:
      externals:
      - spec: cmake@3.18.2
        modules:
        - cmake/1.18.2

  concretization: together
```
which triggers #18338. The first concretization works:
```console
$ spack --env . concretize 
==> Concretized openjpeg
 -   526rapi  openjpeg@2.3.1%gcc@10.1.0 build_type=RelWithDebInfo arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-broadwell
 -   qevuoda      ^cmake@3.18.2%gcc@10.1.0~doc+ncurses+openssl+ownlibs~qt arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-broadwell
 -   kepdmuv      ^zlib@1.2.11%gcc@10.1.0+optimize+pic+shared arch=linux-ubuntu18.04-broadwell

==> Updating view at /home/culpo/tmp/spack-issues/18338/.spack-env/view

$ ls spack.{yaml,lock}
spack.lock  spack.yaml
```
The second attempt at the same command fails and removes `spack.lock` from disk:
```console
$ spack --env . concretize 
==> Error: '546hepoobjp5st4xioqkllziy2tbceoz'

$ ls spack.{yaml,lock}
ls: cannot access 'spack.lock': No such file or directory
spack.yaml
```

### Error Message

See above for a description of the issue.

### Information on your system

* **Spack:** 0.15.4-803-370163393
* **Python:** 3.6.9
* **Platform:** linux-ubuntu18.04-broadwell

### Additional information

The issue is due to these lines in the `write` method of the `Environment` class:

https://github.com/spack/spack/blob/3a5746c6c75d4187e0e6dfc3665a2e34c30de37a/lib/spack/spack/environment.py#L1515-L1517

that delete an existing `spack.lock` file before ensuring that a new one can be generated properly. 

- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
- [x] I have run the failing commands in debug mode and reported the output
